metadata.synopsis: Lady Ague is the leader of the Ladie's Court, Nine-Fingers' elite personal bodyguard. They're each as deadly as disease, and named for such.They don't waste much time talking - in these lines, they're simply stating the way they'd kill us if they had to and, later, the name they'd give us if we joined them. In one final edge-case they repeat the same mantra as a threat if Nine-Fingers is dead and we're taking over.We only learn any of this when Lady Ague herself explains the strangeness.

0.speaker: Lady Ague
0.text: We serve her still, and so do you.
0.context: NodeContext: Spoken like a loyal soldier's mantra

1.speaker: Lady Ague
1.text: Don't mind the Lady's Court. Just playing a new game - what we'd call you if you joined our ranks. Way you're going, we just might let you.

2.speaker: Lady Ague
2.text: Don't mind the Lady's Court. Just a game we play - figuring how we'll kill you if you cross Nine-Fingers.

5.speaker: Lady Ague
5.text: Don't mind the Lady's Court. Just playing our last game - our warning to any who presume to take Nine-Fingers' place.
5.context: NodeContext: Bitter - repeating the same phrase she always has, but with the edge that now the boss to whom she was fiercely loyal is now dead.
